content:
The changes are written to disk when Thunderbird closed and are stored in a file prefs.js. I guess we are looking for a reason the file might not be updated for you out of the millions of Thunderbird users.

Some common reasons are;

  • The computer has it's power lost before the files are written to disk. (ie just turned off)
  • The profile files are stored somewhere other than the local hard disk. (NAS storage, cloud synced locations and streaming backup included here)
  • The profile folder files are being scanned by the antivirus product and the relevant file is locked by the scanner as the time the write attempt is made. (This often results in prefs(1).js through some huge numerical number of files being written on each shut down and then ignored on startup.)
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Maybe I'm not understanding, but my grasp of Gmail's shared account is that, once you accept the invitation, Gmail directs all shared mail to your personal account. When you reply, it sends from the shared account. That would mean that you do not setup a shared account on Thunderbird, but respond to shared messages from your personal account. This URL explains it that way: https://www.keeping.com/content/gmail-shared-mailbox/
creator: davidsk

content: Okay, I'll try to help. - click settings>privacy&security and verify that 'accept cookies' is checked - click file>new >existing mail account - fill in requirements but DO NOT include password - be sure to include full email address - click the 'retest' button or 'done', whichever there is. - at this point, Google should show a pop-up for your credentials - after entering that, the screen should prompt with 'allow' button - click that and it should work.
creator: davidsk

content: You have a filter to copy messages to a local folder? Why not just delete it? Maybe more info will help. You can also save a lot of space by unsubscribing to AllMail folder.
creator: davidsk

content: I presume this was a POP account. If you deleted the account,the message folders would have been deleted as well if you ticked that option on the delete pane. If you did not, the message folders are still there, but not shown. You can verify their presence by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open profile', and then click the Mail folder and the accountname may appear as a folder name and clicking that should show your message folders. Highlight them and move to the Mail\Local Folders folder and restart Thunderbird to see them.
creator: davidsk
